metadata.name: Potentially Suspicious Office Document Executed From Trusted Location
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of an Office application that points to a document that is located in a trusted location. Attackers often used this to avoid macro security and execute their malicious code.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\explorer.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\dopus.exe'))) AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\excel.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powerpnt.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\winword.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('excel\.exe', 'powerpnt\.exe', 'winword\.exe')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\appdata\\roaming\\microsoft\\templates')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\appdata\\roaming\\microsoft\\word\\startup\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\microsoft office\\root\\templates\\')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\microsoft office\\templates\\'))) AND NOT (endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.dotx')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.xltx')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.potx'))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of an Office application that points to a document that is located in a trusted location. Attackers often used this to avoid macro security and execute their malicious code.

metadata.objective: False positive: Unknown References: Internal Research, https://twitter.com/Max_Mal_/status/1633863678909874176, https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-365-blog/new-security-hardening-policies-for-trusted-documents/ba-p/3023465, https://twitter.com/_JohnHammond/status/1588155401752788994
